title: 2021 McLaren Elva
description: This 2021 McLaren Elva is the 45th example built out of a planned production run of 149 and was delivered new to the selling dealer. The car was sold to its first owner in June 2021 before it was reacquired by the selling dealer in 2022. The windshield-free carbon-fiber body is finished in Norello Red, while power is provided by a 4.0-liter DOHC V8 with two twin-scroll turbochargers and dry-sump lubrication. Additional features include a seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transmission, an Active Air Management System, ProActive Chassis Control II, the Stealth Pack, deployable roll-over protection, electro-hydraulic steering, carbon-ceramic brakes, staggered-dimension super-lightweight forged wheels, a suspension lift system, a quad-outlet exhaust system, Pure White interior accents, and carbon-fiber seats trimmed in black and white leather with red piping and contrast stitching. This McLaren Elva has 681 miles and is now offered in Bellevue, Washington, with a window sticker, clean Carfax report, and a manufacturer's certificate of origin.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 2021 McLaren Elva at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #190,950.
text: This 2021 McLaren Elva is the 45th example built out of a planned production run of 149 and was delivered new to the selling dealer. The car was sold to its first owner in June 2021 before it was reacquired by the selling dealer in 2022. The windshield-free carbon-fiber body is finished in Norello Red, while power is provided by a 4.0-liter DOHC V8 with two twin-scroll turbochargers and dry-sump lubrication. Additional features include a seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transmission, an Active Air Management System, ProActive Chassis Control II, the Stealth Pack, deployable roll-over protection, electro-hydraulic steering, carbon-ceramic brakes, staggered-dimension super-lightweight forged wheels, a suspension lift system, a quad-outlet exhaust system, Pure White interior accents, and carbon-fiber seats trimmed in black and white leather with red piping and contrast stitching. This McLaren Elva has 681 miles and is now offered in Bellevue, Washington, with a window sticker, clean Carfax report, and a manufacturer’s certificate of origin. The Elva was unveiled in late 2019 as part of McLaren’s Ultimate Series lineup with its design and name paying homage to the M1A, B, and C sports racers constructed in partnership between Bruce McLaren and Elva Cars. The open-roof bodywork is wrapped around a carbon-fiber MonoCell II monocoque chassis and is composed of three main carbon-fiber panels along with low-profile carbon-fiber dihedral doors. The absence of a windshield is mitigated by an Active Air Management System that employs a carbon-fiber front deflector to guide air over the cockpit. The studio photos provided in the gallery were taken in May 2023. This example is finished in Norello Red with Galvanic Grey brightwork. Aerodynamic features include a front splitter, a rear diffuser, a body-color carbon-fiber active rear spoiler, intake scoops on each flank, and intake ducts channeling through each door. The car is also equipped with a front lift system. Forged alloy wheels measuring 19×9” up front and 20×11” at the rear are finished in Gloss Black Diamond Cut and wear 245/35 and 305/30 Pirelli P Zero Corsa tires. Sintered cross-drilled and ventilated carbon-ceramic brake rotors measure 390mm in diameter and are acted upon by black-painted, forged monobloc calipers that utilize six pistons up front and four pistons at the rear. Stopping assistance is also provided by the rear spoiler. The cockpit houses carbon-fiber bucket seats that are trimmed in black and white leather accented by Bordeaux Red leather piping and Harissa Red contrast stitching and Elva headrest embroidery. Body-color painted surfaces extend to the upper dash, upper doors, center console, and rear bulkhead, while the door inserts wear Pure White paint. Additional features include a deployable rollover system, a black leather-trimmed padded armrest, shoulder belts, McLaren-branded floor mats, a polished dash-mounted mirror, air conditioning, parking sensors, a rearview camera, a touchscreen infotainment system, and a McLaren sound system. Exposed carbon fiber lines the lower door surfaces, lower dash, sills, and floors. The carbon-fiber steering wheel is wrapped in black leather with a white marker at 12 o’clock, and it hosts carbon-fiber paddle shifters sitting ahead of a body-color instrument binnacle. The digital instrument display shows an odometer reading of 681 miles, 500 of which were added by the selling dealer. The 4.0-liter M840TR V8 is a variant of the powerplant introduced in the 720S and features a flat-plane crankshaft, dry-sump lubrication, and dual twin-scroll turbochargers. Output was factory rated at 804 horsepower at 7,500 rpm and 590 lb-ft of torque at 5,500 rpm, which is sent to the rear wheels via a seven-speed dual-clutch SSG transmission. The double-wishbone suspension incorporates active dampening and roll control via the ProActive Chassis Control II System, which offers comfort, sport, and track modes. Variable Drift Control, Brake Steer, launch control, and variable-rate electro-hydraulic steering are also standard on the Elva model. A plaque affixed to the door jamb lists the car as number 45 of 149. The window sticker lists delivery to McLaren Seattle as well as optional equipment and a total suggested retail price of $1,759,874. The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage. This car does not have a title as it has never been titled or registered.
